item.title: The difference between exclamation mark and asterisk in /etc/shadow
item.description: So, with a terrible case of memory lapsus while wanting to disable password login for a user I couldn’t remember what the difference between “!” and “*” is in the /etc/shadow file. Well man 5 shadow to the rescue Refer to **crypt**(3) for details on how this string is interpreted. If the password field contains some string that is not a valid result of **crypt**(3), for instance ! or *, the user will not be able to use a unix password to log in (but the user may log in the system by other means).
